issue.title: Cucumber custom config strategy with exclusive isolated resources not running the scenarios in parallel
Applying `@ResourceLock` to a single method in a class template completely turns off parallel execution for this class template

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

rename.to: Execution mode is needlessly coarsened for `GLOBAL_READ_WRITE` for containers without execution behavior

rename.from: Execution mode is needlessly restrictive for `GLOBAL_READ_WRITE` lock for containers without execution behavior
rename.to: Execution mode is needlessly restrictive for containers without execution behavior but with children requesting `GLOBAL_READ_WRITE` lock

body:
One idea would be to introduce a new `boolean requiresGlobalReadLock()` method on `Node`. By default, it would return `true` and Cucumber could override it to return `false` for their containers that don't execute any user code or callbacks. Instead of assuming that the direct children of the engine descriptor require the `GLOBAL_READ_LOCK`, `NodeTreeWalker` would call this method and use the topmost node returning `true` in all subtrees as `globalLockDescriptor`.

@mpkorstanje Would that work for Cucumber?

rename.from: Execution mode is needlessly restrictive for containers without execution behavior but with children requesting `GLOBAL_READ_WRITE` lock
rename.to: Execution mode is needlessly restrictive for containers without execution behavior but with isolated children

issue.title: Allow specifying which `Nodes` require the global read lock

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Implementations of `HierarchicalTestEngine` can now specify which nodes
require the global read lock by overriding the new
`Node.isGlobalReadLockRequired()` method to return `false`.

This allows for more fine-grained locks when intermediate container do
not have any behavior of their own and thus do not require even the
global read lock.

Resolves #2982.
